to listen; to hear; to obey; a can (loanword from English "tin"); classifier for canned beverages
слушать; слышать; подчиняться; банка (заимствованное от английского «жесть»); классификатор напитков в банках

heisig_chinese_memo: The corrupt king whispers into his assistant's ear.... "Listen, take these 10 commandments and bury them in the secret compartment under the palace."
Ru_trainchinese:
tīng: (глаг) слышать, слушать; повиноваться; позволять, разрешать; разбирать (судебное дело); решать (государственные вопросы)
tīng: (сущ) консервная банка, жестянка
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If the students don't listen the teacher picks up his tomahawk and opens his mouth wide to yell.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (听, ting, hear) shows a mouth and an ear (耳, er, ear). It is a scene of the loud sound, and listening to the sound. This character used to mean “to laugh with mouth open” before. But now this symbol is used for “listening” instead of the old symbol 聽 (ting, hear) which is too complicated for a common word. (笑, xiao=Hsiao, laugh) Above are bamboo tree’s leaves, and a person is laughing loudly with his neck bent backward .
humanum_full_description_en:
" Listen " oracle bone inscriptions from the " ear " from the " mouth ", or from the two " mouths ", like sound into the ear, which means hearing. Bronze inscriptions often start from " ear " and " mouth ", and are written as " 𦔻 ". The clan emblem of the Shang Dynasty had the form of two " ears " and two " mouths ", which was regarded as the original text of " listening ". " 𦔻 " can be added from " people ", or from " earth " from " ancient ", which is similar to " sage ", and earth should be the error of " ren ". In ancient times, " sheng ", " listening ", and " sound " are the same words, which mainly come from the ear to the mouth, which means that the sound comes from the mouth to the ear (see Guo Moruo). Bronze inscriptions often use " sage " to indicate hearing. "Shuowen": "Ling Ye, Cong Er, □, Ren Sheng." Ren Sheng is the form of " Sheng " under the ear.

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning of hearing, hearing, governing, and governing, such as "the king listens to no evil"; it is also used as the name of a person, a country, and a sacrifice. Bronze inscriptions express obedience and acceptance, such as Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Take orders from the emperor", Zhongshan Wang Ding: "Old Jia runs without (listen to) fate"; it is also used as a name. See the characters " Sheng " and " Sound ".
humanum_short_description_en: " listening " oracle bone inscriptions from the " ear " from the " mouth ", or from the two " mouths ", like sound into the ear, it means hearing.
humanum_full_description:
「聽」甲骨文從「耳」從「口」，或從二「口」，象聲音入耳，表示聽聞。金文多從「耳」從「口」，隸作「𦔻」。商代族徽有從兩「耳」兩「口」之形，當為「聽」之初文。「𦔻」或加從「人」，或從「土」從「古」，與「聖」形近，土當為「壬」之訛。古「聖」、「聽」、「聲」同字，主要從耳從口，表示聲出於口而入於耳(參郭沫若)。金文多用「聖」表示聽聞。《說文》：「聆也，从耳、□，壬聲。」壬聲當即是「聖」字耳下之人訛變作壬之形。

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示聽聞、聽治、聽政，如「王聽不隹禍」；又用為人名、方國名、祭名。金文表示聽從、接受，如洹子孟姜壺：「聽命于天子」，中山王□鼎：「老賈奔走不𦔻(聽)命」；又用為人名。參「聖」、「聲」字。
humanum_short_description: 「聽」甲骨文從「耳」從「口」，或從二「口」，象聲音入耳，表示聽聞。

①用耳朵接受聲音：聽力。聽寫。聽覺。聆聽。洗耳恭聽。
②順從，接受別人的意見：言聽計從。
③任憑，隨：聽任(rèn)。聽憑。聽之任之。
④治理；判斷：聽訟(審理案件)。聽政。
⑤量詞，指馬口鐵密封成筒狀以貯藏食物、飲料等：一聽可口可樂。

「 聽 」甲骨文從「 耳 」從「 口 」，或從二「 口 」，象聲音入耳，表示聽聞。金文多從「 耳 」從「 口 」，隸作「 𦔻 」。商代族徽有從兩「 耳 」兩「 口 」之形，當為「 聽 」之初文。「 𦔻 」或加從「 人 」，或從「 土 」從「 古 」，與「 聖 」形近，土當為「 壬 」之訛。古「 聖 」、「 聽 」、「 聲 」同字，主要從耳從口，表示聲出於口而入於耳(參郭沫若)。金文多用「 聖 」表示聽聞。《說文》：「聆也，从耳、□，壬聲。」壬聲當即是「 聖 」字耳下之人訛變作壬之形。 甲骨文用作本義，表示聽聞、聽治、聽政，如「王聽不隹禍」；又用為人名、方國名、祭名。金文表示聽從、接受，如洹子孟姜壺：「聽命于天子」，中山王□鼎：「老賈奔走不𦔻(聽)命」；又用為人名。參「 聖 」、「 聲 」字。
" Listen" oracle bone inscriptions from the " ear" from the " mouth", or from the two " mouths", like sound into the ear, which means hearing. Bronze inscriptions often start from " ear" and " mouth", and are written as " 𦔻". The clan emblem of the Shang Dynasty had the form of two " ears" and two " mouths", which was regarded as the original text of " listening". " 𦔻" can be added from " people", or from " earth" from " ancient", which is similar to " sage", and earth should be the error of " ren". In ancient times, " sheng", " listening", and " sound" are the same words, which mainly come from the ear to the mouth, which means that the sound comes from the mouth to the ear (see Guo Moruo). Bronze inscriptions often use " sage" to indicate hearing. "Shuowen": "Ling Ye, Cong Er, □, Ren Sheng." Ren Sheng is the form of " Sheng" under the ear. The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning of hearing, hearing, governing, and governing, such as "the king listens to no evil"; it is also used as the name of a person, a country, and a sacrifice. Bronze inscriptions express obedience and acceptance, such as Huanzi Meng Jianghu: "Take orders from the emperor", Zhongshan Wang Ding: "Old Jia runs without (listen to) fate"; it is also used as a name. See the characters " Sheng" and " Sound".

聽字的基本解释

聽
tīng
见“听”。

聽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tīng］
［《廣韻》他丁切，平青，透。］
［《廣韻》他定切，去徑，透。］
亦作“聴1”。亦作“聼1”。“听2”的繁体字。
(1)以耳受声。
(2)听从，接受。
(3)审察；断决；治理。
(4)耳目，间谍。
(5)等候，等待。
(6)耳朵。
(7)谓美名善誉。
(8)指打牌时整副牌基本凑齐，只等最后一张即可和牌的状态。
(9)同“廳”。厅堂。
(10)［英tin］马口铁罐。如：听装午餐肉；听装咖啡。亦用作听装物品的量名。如：一听香烟；一听奶粉。
[②]［tīng］
［《廣韻》他定切，去徑，透。］
亦作“聴2”。亦作“聼2”。“听3”的繁体字。
听凭，任凭。

聽字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【耳字部】　聽； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页970第24
〔古文〕?【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?他定切，音侹。【說文】聆也。【釋名】聽，靜也。靜，然後所聞審也。【書·太甲】聽德惟聰。【儀禮·士昏禮】命之曰：敬恭聽，宗爾父母之言。　又【廣韻】待也。　又受也。【左傳·成十一年】鄭伯如晉聽成。【註】聽，猶受也。　又從也。【易·艮卦】不拯其隨未退聽也。【疏】聽，從也。【左傳·昭二十六年】姑慈婦聽。　又斷也。【禮·王制】司寇正?明辟，以聽獄訟。【周禮·天官·大宰】凡邦之小治，則冢宰聽之。【前漢·?法志】一曰辭聽，二曰色聽，三曰氣聽，四曰耳聽，五曰目聽。　又任也。【前漢·景帝紀】其議民欲徙寬大地者，聽之。　又?也。【戰國策】請爲王聽東方之處。【註】聽，偵?之。　又【唐韻】他丁切【集韻】【韻會】湯丁切【正韻】他經切，?音㕔。【集韻】聆也，聽受也。中庭曰聽事，言受事察訟於是。俗作㕔。毛氏曰：漢晉皆作聽，六朝以來始加厂。　又【韻補】叶儻陽切，音堂。【蘇轍·讀道藏詩】昔者惠子死，莊子笑自傷。微言不復知，言之使誰聽。

小篆楷体

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tīng］
["Guang Yun" He Ding cut, flat green, through. ]
["Guangyun" He is determined to cut, go to the path, and thoroughly. ]
Also known as "聴1". Also called "Listen 1". The traditional characters of "听2".
(1) Receive sound with ears.
(2) Obey and accept.
(3) Inspection; judgment; governance.
(4) Eyes and ears, spies.
(5) Wait, wait.
(6) Ears.
(7) It is called good reputation and good reputation.
(8) Refers to the state in which the entire deck of cards is basically assembled, and only the last card can be tied.
(9) Same as "hall". Hall.
(10) [British tin] tinplate cans. Such as: canned luncheon meat; canned coffee. It is also used as the name of the canned item. Such as: a can of cigarettes; a can of milk powder.
[②]［tīng］
["Guangyun" He is determined to cut, go to the path, and thoroughly. ]
Also known as "聴2". Also called "Listen 2". "听3" in traditional characters.
Let it go, let it go.

Clearly, in order to listen to prison lawsuits. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Da Zai】The small rule of the world, the scorpion will listen to it. [Previous Han·Fazhi] Firstly, listening to speech, secondly listening for secrecy, thirdly listening for breath, fourthly listening for ears, and listening for eyes fifthly.　 Ren Ye. [Previous Han·Jing Di Ji] If the people want to move to the land, listen to it.　 Again? [Warring States Policy] Please listen to the east for the king.
